intro: Hoffmannia manussatani, commonly known as the Manussatani's hoffmannia, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
